cards.flavor: Why bother waiting for the future?
cards.name: Accelerate Fate
cards.text: Draw three cards. Discard two cards at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Ada, the Free

rulings.text: The new target has the same restrictions as the original, and can't be the same target. If there is only one legal target, Ada's second ability does nothing.
If an effect can't be duplicated, such the attachment of a card with fabled as it enters the battlefield, choose one of those targets for that part of the effect.

cards.text:
Distorted (This creature can be blocked by tapped creatures but not untapped creatures.)
As you choose targets for an instant or sorcery spell, choose up to one additional target.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, gain control of another target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Reading her fates is child's play. Changing her fates is a fool's errand.
cards.name: Ada's Mischief

rulings.text: The spell effect added will occur after any effects the spell already has. Notably, if the spell would prevent all damage that would be dealt to its controller, it prevents the damage that will be dealt by itself.

cards.text: Target instant or sorcery spell gains “This spell deals 4 damage to you.”

cards.name: Aetherial Ascent
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. You get a glory counter. (You lose glory counters before life. A player with ten or more glory counters wins the game.)

cards.flavor: One of many treasures lost to the Mirror.
cards.name: Ahl's Study
cards.text:
{T}, Discard a card: Add {C}.
Whenever you discard one or more cards, you may pay {2}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Ahl the Mirrorwalker
cards.text:
[+2]: Create a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying.
[-2]: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's an enchantment or land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it in your hand.
[-7]: Draw seven cards.

cards.name: Airam, Packleader
cards.text:
Frenzy 2 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Airam, Packleader becomes blocked, other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Aleena, Grace of the Lha
cards.text:
Vigilance, lifelink
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained life or glory this turn, you get a glory counter. (You lose glory counters before life. A player with ten or more glory counters wins the game.)

cards.name: Aleud Beastmaster
cards.text: Aleud Beastmaster has frenzy X, where X is the number of unblocked attacking creatures you control. (Whenever it attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +X/+0 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Aleud Bladedancer
cards.text:
Frenzy 1 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Aleud Bladedancer has hexproof as long as it's attacking.

cards.name: Aleud Blademaster
cards.text:
Frenzy 2 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Aleud Blademaster becomes blocked, it gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Aleud Grace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has hexproof.
Sacrifice Aleud Grace: Enchanted creature gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Aleud Pathfinder
cards.text:
Frenzy 1 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Aleud Pathfinder becomes blocked, untap up to two lands you control.

cards.flavor: Spells made to murder.
cards.name: Aleud Scorn

rulings.text: The triggered ability is not a mana ability.

cards.text:
Aleud Scorn deals 3 damage to target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile Aleud Scorn from your graveyard. If you do, add {R}{R}.

cards.name: Alyss, Lawweaver

rulings.text: If an effect can't be duplicated, such the attachment of an Aura or a card with fabled as it enters the battlefield, its controller chooses one of those targets for that part of the effect.

cards.text:
Distorted (This creature can be blocked by tapped creatures but not untapped creatures.)
If a spell or ability would target you, it targets each player instead.
Whenever an opponent attacks you with one or more creatures, tap all noncreature permanents that player controls.

cards.name: Anaz, Bloodmother
cards.text:
Haste
Frenzy 3 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Anaz, Bloodmother attacks, create a 2/1 red Lizard creature token with frenzy 2 that's tapped and attacking.

cards.name: Ancient Gleam
cards.text:
Choose one—
• You gain life equal to the number of artifacts you control.
• You gain life equal to the number of enchantments you control.

cards.flavor: Those who do not comply with the newest regulations will find themselves terminated.
cards.name: Annihilate Aggressor
cards.text: Exile target attacking creature. You get a glory counter. (You lose glory counters before life. A player with ten or more glory counters wins the game.)

cards.name: Arisen Haploc
cards.text:
When Arisen Haploc enters, return target creature card from a graveyard to its owner's hand.
Revive {5}{B}{B} ({5}{B}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: The dreaming are not the dead.
cards.name: Arroyo, the Bound

rulings.text: If Arroyo leaves the battlefield, the cards exiled by it can't be drawn by another Arroyo. Their owner can still look at them longingly.

cards.text:
If a player would draw a card, instead that player may put a card they own exiled with Arroyo, the Bound into their hand.
{3}: Search target player's library for a card and exile it face down, then that player shuffles. They may look at that card for as long as it remains exiled.

cards.flavor: Losing an eye is grounds for losing a second.
cards.name: Arroyo's Servant
cards.text:
Winnow (Damage dealt to this creature also causes you to lose that much life.)
{2}{B}: Each creature blocking Arroyo's Servant gains winnow until end of turn.

cards.flavor: There is no forgiveness on Ophorio, so you'd best make certain you have permission.
cards.name: Augment Authority
cards.text: Counter target spell. If you are glorious, draw a card. (You are glorious as long as you have a glory counter.)

changes: 2022-06-01 — Updated 'card' wording to 'spell' for Adventures and modal DFCs.
cards.name: Aurora, Soulweaver
cards.text:
Distorted (This creature can be blocked by tapped creatures but not untapped creatures.)
During each of your turns, you may cast an instant or sorcery spell from your graveyard. If that spell would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.
Whenever Aurora, Soulweaver attacks, untap any number of target creatures.

cards.flavor: The bigger the scorpion, the less the poison matters.
cards.name: Avalanche Stinger
cards.text:
Frenzy 2 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.)
Blocked creatures you control have first strike.

cards.name: Better Half
cards.text: You may have Better Half enter as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it's a Reflection in addition to its other creature types and it has distorted. (It can be blocked by tapped creatures but not untapped creatures.)

cards.flavor: It's important to keep your food and magical brews away from wild animals.
cards.name: Blazebrew Bear
cards.text: Trample

cards.name: Blazing Fox
cards.text:
Trample, haste
When Blazing Fox enters, you may tap an untapped creature you control. If you do, Blazing Fox gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that creature's power.

cards.flavor: The promise of power lured the lizards into carriers of contamination.
cards.name: Blighted Haploc
cards.text:
{1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains winnow until end of turn. (Damage dealt to it also causes its controller to lose that much life.)
{3}{B}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-2 and gains winnow until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Learning from mistakes is an excellent way to improve. No one said they had to be your mistakes.
cards.name: Blood Bounty
cards.text: Whenever an attacking creature you or a teammate controls dies, you lose 1 life and draw a card.

cards.flavor: Free from the prisons of civilization, some lizards go berserk.
cards.name: Bloodmad Refugee
cards.text: Frenzy 1 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: The great snakes in the forest sleep deeply, only to be awakened by the blood spilled upon their scales.
cards.name: Bloodscale Serpent
cards.text: This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature that attacked this turn.

cards.flavor: Trying to sneak up on them just ensures your death will be painful.
cards.name: Bogclaw Sniper
cards.text:
First strike
{T}: Bogclaw Sniper deals 2 damage to target blocking creature.

cards.flavor: Traveling through the mires is a death sentence to the unscaled.
cards.name: Bogclaw Swarm
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay 3 life. If you do, create a 2/1 red Lizard creature token with frenzy 2. (Whenever it attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: With skilled hands, some strands of fate can be made real, contained to be use in spells or potions.
cards.name: Bottled Fate

rulings.text: Neither of the cards are drawn. If you have multiple libraries, you choose one library to take the top and bottom cards of.

cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice Bottled Fate: Put the top card and bottom card of your library into your hand.

cards.flavor: A sight for making sore eyes.
cards.name: Brilliant Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
When Brilliant Griffin enters, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Feeding your troops blazebrew is a sure way to set them on their enemies and set their enemies on fire.
cards.name: Burned Bounty
cards.text: Whenever an attacking creature you or a teammate controls dies, Burned Bounty deals damage equal to that creature's power to each opponent.

cards.name: Bygone Blade

rulings.text: You can't unequip Equipment.

cards.flavor:
“When day and night combine with blight, its prey unites with blood and wight.”
—The Lost Verse III
cards.name: Carrier Pigeon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Carrier Pigeon attacks or blocks, target creature gains winnow until end of turn. (Damage dealt to it also causes its controller to lose that much life.)

cards.name: Carrionpult
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield under target player's control. That creature deals damage equal to its power to that player.

cards.flavor: Beat them with their own chains.
cards.name: Chainslinger
cards.text:
Haste
Winnow (Damage dealt to this creature also causes you to lose that much life.)

cards.flavor: The two planes began to overlay in spectacular, and gruesome, fashion.
cards.name: Chew the Scenery

rulings.text: You may play lands this way if you have land drops remaining.

cards.text: Each player sacrifices X lands. Chew the Scenery deals X damage to each creature.

cards.flavor: They can take your wings, but your fate is always your own.
cards.name: Clipped Seer
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may shuffle target card an opponent owns in exile into its owner's library.

cards.flavor: No one quite knows what lies on the watery horizon to the far north. None have dared to go, lest the rumors of monsters and the end of the world be true.

Comfortable Commoner

Flying

cards.flavor: “One day it hit me, that so many of us were lost in our fates, vainly trying to craft a life we had never lived. I didn't want that. They tell me I will die, but at least I will have lived.”

cards.flavor: “When I'm done, you won't even remember what the old you was like.”

cards.text: Target player gains control of target ability or nonpermanent spell. You may choose new targets for it.

cards.flavor: Most lizards have taken to two legs, favoring spears and dexterity to the strength they once had. Others have doubled down on it instead.

cards.text: Secretly choose a creature card name. Target opponent chooses a creature you don't control. Firing Blind deals 5 damage to that creature. Reveal the chosen name, then if that creature has the chosen name, Firing Blind deals 3 damage to that opponent.

cards.text:

[-4]: Put target nonland permanent on the bottom of its owner's library.

The Erased will prevent any abilities that function in these zones, such as Destiny, Engorge, Erratic, Inscribe, Purge, Prophecy, and Reprise.
